title: Program Catalog Marketing Management

school.name: School of Accountancy, Management, Computing, and Information Studies (SAMCIS)

program_name: Bachelor of Science in Business Administration Major in Marketing Management
slu_vision_mission: Saint Louis University is envisioned as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing human resources imbued with Christian Spirit and who are creative, competent and socially involved.
school_vision_mission: The School of Accountancy, Management, Computing, and Information Studies (SAMCIS) is envisioned as the center of excellence in Business, Management, and Information Technology Education, committed to the creative, competent, and Christian formation of individuals who can be agents of progress in the changing local and international business and IT environments.
educational_objectives: Develop one’s personality and competencies, continually and holistically, as a Louisian marketer, to keep abreast with local and global developments.
Practice professionalism, ethics, social responsibility, inclusiveness, and teamwork in marketing practice.
Integrate Filipino traits, values, and cultural heritage in all marketing endeavors.
Adopt Christian practices and values to support diversity and multiculturalism in the profession and society.
Formulate innovative ideas and projects contributing to socio-economic development and cultural understanding.
Exhibit marketing philosophies and adapt to developments shaping the future of business administration.
Develop inclusive, value-based management decisions for business governance.
learning_outcomes: Apply competencies in social sciences, math, accounting, business law, IT, and marketing management philosophies in business administration.
Demonstrate creativity and critical thinking in applying key marketing concepts and the marketing mix (product, price, place, promotion) toward customer satisfaction.
Assess environmental forces and trends to guide marketing decisions and practices.
Communicate business concepts effectively in English and Filipino using appropriate technology.
Demonstrate proficiency in conducting marketing research and implementing marketing programs.
Work effectively and independently in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams.
Practice Christian values in both personal and professional life as Louisians in service of the CICM mission.

admission_policies.freshmen: Must pass SLU College Entrance Examination (SLU-CEE), conducted mid-October to mid-December. Admission starts mid-April.
admission_policies.transferees: Accepted in all programs except BS in Medical Laboratory Science. Must take Qualifying Exam (QE), then Personality Test and Interview. Foreign transferees must pass the English Proficiency Test (EPT).
admission_policies.graduate_students: Master’s: must hold a baccalaureate degree. Doctorate: must hold a master’s degree in a related field.
foreign_students: Must apply at least 6 months before the start of term.
Must be in Baguio 4 weeks before start of classes.
Must pass: EPT, SLU-CEE/QE/GPEE, and Personality Test.
Must undergo Preadmission Processing at the Student Affairs Office.
Must secure a valid Student Visa.

tuition_and_fees.note: Subject to change without prior notice
